ygData.subject: Re: Spell Questions
ygData.msgSnippet: The simplest way to do it if you are at Erudin is to go to the docks and fish.. while fishing target the Shark (don t go in the water) and cast your combat
ygData.messageBody:
The simplest way to do it if you are at Erudin is to go to the docks and
fish.. while fishing target the Shark (don't go in the water) and cast your
combat spells... it will cause your evoke to go up and it will also speed up
the casting time with out the inherent danger of hunting (plus the added
bonus of fishing).



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bill Long [mailto:bill@...]
> Sent: Friday, April 16, 1999 4:40 PM
> To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com'
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Spell Questions
>
>
> From: Bill Long <bill@...>
>
> Your evocation will almost always be at the max possible level, unless you
> never hunt. You'll notice that right after you gain a new level, your
> evocation and channeling will quickly go up by 5 and then will
> stop. This is
> because the max your skills can reach is based on your level:
>
> (level * 5) + 5
>
> So, at level 3 for instance, your evocation will max out at 20 (3
> times 5 is
> 15, plus 5 is 20) and will not rise again until you level again.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bemeraroi@... [mailto:Bemeraroi@...]
> Sent: Friday, April 16, 1999 6:11 PM
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Spell Questions
>
>
> From: Bemeraroi@...
>
> anyone know of a easy way to build of evoke other than hunting, like i
> usually built up my abjuration by casting shield alot. and i
> curently use a
>
> dagger should i train in staffs 1 or 2 handed since i found a worn great
> staff on a skeleton?
>
> Samurai
>
